title: World History and Geography 1500 to Present
subject: History and Social Science (2015-2023)

document.title: History and Social Science Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

14A1D1F05FA54770B9F42E9C58AF09C5.description: locating the geographic distribution of religions in the contemporary world.

120D5673CEAC4C2E898AF8A0B0E5E6A8.description: describing their beliefs, sacred writings, traditions, and customs; and

0A2E6637E05D491786B9B135CDB29E4F.description:
The student will demonstrate knowledge of the influence of Judaism, Christianity,
Islam, Buddhism, and Hinduism in the contemporary world by

30C246E530C045D6BF108BAE7EB31E13.description: analyzing the increasing impact of terrorism.

69A69990C00D4A889331EF7905110739.description:
describing economic interdependence, including the rise of multinational
corporations, international organizations, and trade agreements; and

6AD126937A7042E29F1AD88B8632D8BE.description: assessing the link between economic and political freedom;

37239B9876B44DC0B0E3DF0E4AB2D04B.description:
The student will apply social science skills to understand the global changes during the
early twenty-first century by

D297E9D30CB941CF84847B3FAFD3729D.description:
describing the end of the mandate system and the creation of states in the Middle
East, including the roles of Golda Meir and Gamal Abdel Nasser.

AFCABBF3086C4F56828FA435117871BF.description:
describing Africa’s independence movements, including Jomo Kenyatta’s
leadership of Kenya and Nelson Mandela’s role in South Africa; and

B88B7B6D45784F80979F769E543544EA.description:
describing the struggles for self-rule, including Gandhi’s leadership in India and the
development of India’s democracy;

4E6C70806D5E437689D7171859835ED1.description:
The student will apply social science skills to understand the political, economic,
social, and cultural aspects of independence movements and development efforts by

153C01A9F67B4DC492B0FEED90610925.description:
examining the political and economic shifts that led to the end of the Cold War,
with emphasis on Margaret Thatcher, Mikhail Gorbachev, and Ronald Reagan.

005B70EBCE654EDD965CE1DFA26CBBBA.description:
describing conflicts and revolutionary movements in Asia and their major leaders,
including Mao Tse-tung (Zedong), Chiang Kai-shek, Deng Xiaoping, and Ho Chi
Minh; and

2B975F7D843A4A169F047503EE8D4DD2.description:
describing the major leaders and events of the Cold War, including the location of
major conflicts;

4A1109E6C7BA443E94640AFC5FC3BCA6.description:
The student will apply social science skills to understand the conflicts during the
second half of the twentieth century by

3D196263A9AC489AB64AF754C80998FD.description:
examining the effects of the war, with emphasis on the terms of the peace, the war
crimes trials, the division of Europe, plans to rebuild Germany and Japan, and the
creation of international cooperative organizations and the Universal Declaration of
Human Rights (1948).

E9F6EC01C03E416F95FE98E530F60E2E.description:
examining the Holocaust and other examples of genocide in the twentieth century;
and

FCE10B8520CA4564B0FECB88337A5D02.description:
describing the major events, including major battles and the role of new
technologies;

B03B49DB5F9545B08E2D9639DFF41003.description: explaining the major causes of the war;

2766DCE82B5441B5B12235277688E35C.description:
The student will apply social science skills to understand World War II and its
worldwide impact by

D9ABEBD3A59C4429978614091FBEBFFA.description:
explaining the causes and assessing the impact of worldwide depression in the
1930s; and

544851CC6A3047E2B926167046DFC834.description: citing causes and consequences of the Russian Revolution;

A6F30DA337AD40B9A703281A5FB8799C.description:
analyzing and explaining the terms of the Treaty of Versailles and the actions of the
League of Nations, with emphasis on the mandate system;

C299DCDFF67C4AEC951129F34B9D90A3.description: describing the location of major battles and the role of new technologies;

283D8EEE5B3A4A4D831E9CCA1978A4B1.description:
explaining economic and political causes and identifying major leaders of the war,
with emphasis on Woodrow Wilson and Kaiser Wilhelm II;

E6A70F6B412744308F50CEAC7C712D97.description:
The student will apply social science skills to understand World War I and its
worldwide impact by

15F195DA5821479CAA5E983D25EE3FA9.description: analyzing the relationship between industrialization, imperialism, and nationalism.

3F0DA6FCB0F34BC692C9E1CA0F650227.description:
assessing the impact of European colonization and imperialism on Asia, Africa, the
Pacific Islands, and Australia; and

FDC5C4D1AD7B4BB4896A8F22C2424BAF.description:
describing the political and social challenges faced by Latin American nations, with
emphasis on the Monroe Doctrine;

DFBEF59B3CF5484989523B93C0512048.description:
locating the United States of America, describing its expansion between 1776 and
1900, and assessing its changing role in the world;

EB4D2E39CD6B49A6B80547C82F66924A.description:
The student will apply social science skills to understand global interactions between
1800 to about 1900 by

2BC22F49B12A480BBAD787119DB23A1C.description:
explaining the events related to the unification of Germany and the role of
Bismarck.

87E5C0B0B92A486583454E0F5277B62E.description:
explaining the events related to the unification of Italy and the role of Italian
nationalism; and

E9727BC1AB894387B8FF00C57691865B.description:
assessing the impact of Napoleon and the Congress of Vienna on political power in
Europe;

66DDD3D7ADA44BE0A0036AFE32DBAA2D.description:
describing how industrialization affected economic and political systems in Europe,
with emphasis on the slave trade and the labor union movement;

9D40C4CBA9434EDBBA8CC9F28DCB023A.description:
explaining the roles of resources, capital, and entrepreneurship in developing an
industrial economy;

23DAAB783D364E1CAF1AC05B8809B3CC.description:
The student will apply social science skills to understand the changes in European
nations between 1800 and 1900 by

D7680912272F4EF88B44DC5045A058D6.description: explaining the development of political and economic systems in African societies.

FEC04037138C4A259297F9A29160A429.description:
comparing and contrasting the development of social and cultural patterns in
Central and Southern Africa; and

0997F457585849C79D998DF7CF27330E.description:
comparing and contrasting the development of social and cultural patterns in East
Africa and West Africa;

941428706B954B898FFE1108F3333040.description:
locating major societies in Africa in time and place and identifying major
geographic features;

B02345706C2449AAAE77BFD2143EEDCD.description:
The student will demonstrate an understanding of the political, cultural, geographic,
and economic conditions in sub-Saharan Africa from about 1500 A.D. (C.E.) to about
1800 A.D. (C.E.) by

E7E9563FB5A5485D87DA7EC5D5E201EE.description: comparing and contrasting the political and economic systems of Asian empires.

D3F58FDB5F7642F3B7A505BD1633AFE9.description:
describing the location and development of social and cultural patterns in Japan,
with emphasis on the Japanese shogunate; and

42CC0136FD2D42EBAC2BE4FCA2D4379B.description:
describing the location and development of social and cultural patterns in China,
with emphasis on the Qing (Manchu) dynasty;

E3C8593323F84AE0AA0EA6BB617E2F0D.description:
describing the location and development of social and cultural patterns in India,
with emphasis on the Mughal Empire and coastal trade;

AED6D6FAB62345CD94CAB4D6EFFB3FFB.description:
describing the location and development of social and cultural patterns in the
Ottoman Empire;

15C54901463F49928D880C50986722F3.description: locating Asian empires in time and place and identifying major geographic features;

5E221E06D62E4828B2D744D45F58D918.description:
The student will apply social science skills to understand the political, cultural,
geographic, and economic conditions in Asia from about 1500 A.D. (C.E) to about
1800 A.D. (C.E) by

D487A3E03C33456C935AE57F897E405D.description:
describing the development of social and cultural patterns in Russia, with emphasis
on Peter the Great.

0A864AB9E73D47379542C6E27A5F09B8.description: describing the development of social and cultural patterns in the Italian states; and

339850B4F6A847E1BBAB89931E7136DC.description: describing the development of social and cultural patterns in the German states;

964D756FE5F04600B869FAACE70FD14B.description: explaining the causes and effects of the American and French Revolutions;

9370C4E3168E4E119844A2E3084E99C1.description:
describing the development of social and cultural patterns in France, with emphasis
on the Age of Absolutism, Louis XIV, and the Enlightenment period;

E433E92D6E3E4E788598EDC35B2E0E64.description:
describing the development of social and cultural patterns in the Hapsburg empire,
with emphasis on Charles V;

660AF9FCA7034541839667C6DA7E6ABB.description:
locating European nations and their empires in time and place and identifying major
geographic features of Europe;

D4A06C44DDE64859981851A6C5F803A3.description:
The student will apply social science skills to understand the political, cultural,
geographic, and economic conditions in Europe and Russia from about 1500 A.D.
(C.E) to about 1800 A.D. (C.E) by

26540987E36A4905A6AD285CD9EA99E1.description:
defining and describing how the Scientific Revolution led to social and
technological changes that influenced the European view of the world.

9BEBED6A528B42CC99ED9195B55E067F.description:
analyzing how competition for colonies changed the economic system of Europe;
and

A434807CC3DC4542A03EE4EA6A5D7E98.description:
comparing and contrasting the social and cultural influences of European settlement
on Africa, Asia, and the Americas;

43BB4C9CBC2E4E5CB6065E94864EC6F7.description: describing the geographic expansion into Africa, Asia, and the Americas;

C52AD435151B459FAA5AE5504449D0B7.description:
explaining the political and economic goals of European exploration and
colonization;

E0C71A7C782D4185AA2E841543381FA6.description:
The student will apply social science skills to understand the impact of the European
Age of Exploration by

8AAE0534649D4CA9801BB1C5FB4BE23E.description:
describing how the Reformation led to changing cultural values, traditions, and
philosophies, and assessing the role of the printing press.

4A358F061FA3488A96FAE93713045525.description:
describing the impact of religious conflicts, the Inquisition, and the Catholic
Reformation on society and government actions; and

40F0E6DEF558478FB4B3F0741BCF62D4.description:
The student will apply social science skills to understand the Reformation in terms of
its impact on Western civilization by

8FF9AAD2D56E428FAA0C34C874162C4F.description: Emergence of a Global Age, 1500 to 1800 A.D. (C.E.)

B7814AC76649493684A11BB190FB5AB0.description: citing major technological and scientific exchanges in the Eastern Hemisphere.

ACE73B3F77944612BD90E0DE0EECD2C6.description: describing the distribution of major religions;

C225C626E7ED40FE8D0E35176E239B6C.description: describing artistic, literary, and intellectual ideas of the Renaissance;

7EC12D904B4A4D739CB8D8EB49A79701.description:
The student will apply social science skills to understand the political, cultural,
geographic, and economic conditions in the world about 1500 A.D. (C.E.) by

E666E79C09ED4CB29C948605153FBD22.description: investigating and researching to develop products orally and in writing.

36903052DF9E4EFB8DEEC16E2FB8F219.description:
identifying the rights and responsibilities of citizens and ethical use of materials and
intellectual property; and

14672981943A4C9683A3B33512DF93C0.description:
using a decision-making model to analyze and explain the incentives for and
consequences of a specific choice made;

C21C9F9DB656473E8FC28D4AFB27147C.description: analyzing multiple connections across time and place;

47F0E0B553BB4704813C6BC4C4D632FB.description:
explaining how indirect cause-and-effect relationships impacted people, places, and
events in world history;

B334F92F096B4C9EA49D9B45F1FF82F2.description:
comparing and contrasting historical, cultural, economic, and political perspectives
in world history;

1AC55B27D2CA49EC9432F2C6FB77B115.description: evaluating sources for accuracy, credibility, bias, and propaganda;

DC55E282A588476BBC3E11BC560EB894.description:
interpreting charts, graphs, and pictures to determine characteristics of people,
places, or events in world history;

7C13D79788624A44B66749FF28E73F17.description: using geographic information to determine patterns and trends in world history;

D38A022BE29B4D4EA4FB7725522810A8.description:
synthesizing evidence from artifacts and primary and secondary sources to obtain
information about events and life in world history;

41704D6DBE044FC1948F49882FFA426C.description:
The student will demonstrate skills for historical thinking, geographical analysis,
economic decision making, and responsible citizenship by
